skills.name: Identify if a quantity is increased or decreased when multiplied by a fraction

explanations.A: 2/3 is less than 1, so 8 x 2/3 will be less than 8 x 1 (which is 8).
explanations.B: This symbol means greater than. Will 8 x 2/3 give us an answer greater than 8 x 1?
explanations.C: Try comparing 8 x 2/3 to 8 x 1. The answer can't be the same, so will it be smaller or bigger?
explanations.D: We can compare these without knowing the exact value - is 2/3 smaller than 1 or bigger? So will 8 x 2/3 be smaller or bigger than 8 x 1?

explanations.A: This symbol means greater than. Will 9 x 3/4 give us an answer greater than 9 x 1?
explanations.B: 3/4 is less than 1, so 9 x 3/4 will be less than 9 x 1 (which is 9).
explanations.C: Try comparing 9 x 3/4 to 9 x 1. The answer can't be the same, so will it be smaller or bigger?
explanations.D: We can compare these without knowing the exact value - is 3/4 smaller than 1 or bigger? So will 9 x 3/4 be smaller or bigger than 9 x 1?

explanations.A: This symbol means less than. Will 11/5 x 4 give us an answer less than 1 x 4? Remember not all fractions are smaller than 1.
explanations.B: 11/5 is greater than 1 (we know this because it's an improper fraction), so 11/5 x 4 will be greater than 1 x 4 (which is 4).
explanations.C: Try comparing 11/5 x 4 to 1 x 4. The answer can't be the same, so is it smaller or bigger?
explanations.D: We can compare these without knowing the exact value - is 11/5 smaller than 1 or bigger? So will 11/5 x 4 be smaller or bigger than 1 x 4?

explanations.A: This symbol means less than. Will 15/7 x 2 give us an answer less than 1 x 2? Remember not all fractions are smaller than 1...
explanations.B: 15/7 is greater than 1 (we know this because it's an improper fraction), so 15/7 x 2 will be greater than 1 x 2 (which is 2).
explanations.C: Try comparing 15/7 x 2 to 1 x 2. The answer can't be the same, so is it smaller or bigger?
explanations.D: We can compare these without knowing the exact value - is 15/7 smaller than 1 or bigger? So will 15/7 x 2 be smaller or bigger than 1 x 2?

explanations.A: This symbol means less than. Will multiplying by 2 make the fraction smaller?
explanations.B: 5/5 x 2 is twice the size of 5/5, so we need to use the greater than symbol.
explanations.C: Try comparing 5/5 x 2 to 5/5 x 1. The answer can't be the same, so is it smaller or bigger?
explanations.D: We can compare these without knowing the exact value - will 5/5 x 2 be smaller or bigger than 5/5 x 1?

explanations.C: Try comparing 6/6 x 2 to 6/6 x 1. The answer can't be the same, so is it smaller or bigger?
explanations.D: We can compare these without knowing the exact value - will 6/6 x 2 be smaller or bigger than 6/6 x 1?

explanations.C: Try comparing 4/7 x 4/7 to 4/7 x 1. The answer can't be the same, so is it smaller or bigger?
explanations.D: We can compare these without knowing the exact value - is 4/7 smaller than 1 or bigger? So will 4/7 x 4/7 be smaller or bigger than 4/7 x 1?

explanations.C: Try comparing 3/10 x 5/8 to 3/10 x 1. The answer can't be the same, so is it smaller or bigger?

explanations.A: This symbol means less than. Will 3 1/2 x 9/8 give us an answer less than 3 1/2 x 1? Remember, not all fractions are less than 1.
explanations.B: 9/8 is greater than 1 (we know this because it's an improper fraction), so 3 1/2 x 9/8 will be greater than 3 1/2 x 1 (which is 3 1/2).
explanations.C: Try comparing 3 1/2 x 9/8 to 3 1/2 x 1. The answer can't be the same, so is it smaller or bigger? Remember that not all fractions are smaller than 1.
explanations.D: We can compare these without knowing the exact value - is 9/8 smaller than 1 or bigger? So will 3 1/2 x 9/8 be smaller or bigger than 3 1/2 x 1?

explanations.A: This symbol means less than. Will 3 1/2 x 9/8 give us an answer less than 3 1/2 x 1? Remember, not all fractions are less than 1.
explanations.B: 11/5 is greater than 1 (we know this because it's an improper fraction), so 4 2/9 x 11/5 will be greater than 4 2/9 x 1 (which is 4 2/9)
explanations.C: Try comparing 4 2/9 x 11/5 to 4 2/9 x 1. The answer can't be the same, so is it smaller or bigger? Remember that not all fractions are smaller than 1...
explanations.D: We can compare these without knowing the exact value - is 11/5 smaller than 1 or bigger? So will 4 2/9 x 11/5 be smaller or bigger than 4 2/9 x 1?
